Synopsis:
-------------
Chicago, thirties. Two small time crooks, Johnny Hooker (Redford) and Henry Gondorff (Newman), decide to avenge the death of a dear old colleague of the guild at the hands of the most powerful gangster in town (played by Robert Shaw). To this ingenious and complicated devise a plan with the help of all friends and acquaintances.


Reviews:
-------------

1) One year after the first installment of The Godfather was filmed this classic dye film recreates the world of Chicago gangsters of the 30. Have been recorded for posterity, and a famous soundtrack, masterful scenes like the poker game on the train or the mail Lonnegan thymus. All this told in a continuous tone of good humor and constant surprises in the script. The film tells the story of a blow, or whatever it is, a large scam. And what he says is great entertainment. It is a witty and entertaining film. The characterization of the various characters is fantastic. The script is unpredictable and the plot develops several stories simultaneously. Ideal for those who feel that the classic movie is boring and predictable. A stunning film.

2) "The Sting" is one of those unforgettable films that over time more and more valuable. In addition to being well constructed, interpreted and set, has memorable scenes linger in the viewer's retina, leaving a sweet taste, a half smile at the end of the film and a sense of having enjoyed for two hours on a few occasions. And, of course, everyone just humming the memorable soundtrack that fits perfectly into the plot of the movie.


Anecdotes and Trivia:
---------------------------

1) It brought back to Newman and Redford, having starred together "Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid" (1969).

2) The script has fun very well marked the times of each part of the film, making it more agile, and is divided into distinct acts by their titles relevant overlays:

The players (the players)
The set-up (The plan)
The tale (The setup)
The Wire (the weft)
The Sting (The Sting)

3) At the Academy Awards that year, Robert Redford was nominated as best lead actor, but the statuette was won by Jack Lemmon for "Save the Tiger", who took the stage to pick with the help of two volunteers due to high state of intoxication.


A who decides to see this movie, you enjoy it.
